reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While this hotel is certainly first class in accommodation and service I was severely disturbed by their policy regarding visitors. Here I had this lovely $400. a night room with sofas, dining tables etc....yet they would not allow a visitor to my room! I was visiting in Cusco and had many friends that I would have like to entertain in my room for drinks and conversation. Certainly in any other city, Paris or New York or London this would be normal. But not here....I suspect that there was a predjudice because my friends were native Peruvians and seemingly not fancy people. I bet if my all american caucasian daughter showed up there would have been no problem..

reviews.text: Would never go here again.

reviews.title: amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We thought this hotel would be a good alternative to Monasterio, where we heard that the rooms were of uneven size and quality. It proved to be a good choice. We reserved a "balcony suite," although it was not really a suite. The rooms open to a beautiful courtyard with a fountain, and outside seating is available there for the restaurant. The buffet breakfast was one of the best we had in South America. There were many appetizing fresh pastries and fruit was abundant. The hot chocolate was perhaps better than Angelina's in Paris! The hotel employees are extremely friendly and eager to please. There are a few glitches to be worked out--the lighting in the room was dim and inadequate, the refrigerator/minibar was not operating, and the pillows were foam (with no feather alternative available). The hotel is located about 2 blocks higher than Monasterio on a steep hill and it can be a difficult climb if the altitude is affecting you. However, the ascent is worth it for the intimate experience you will enjoy at this property.
reviews.title: Stylish and Intimate

reviews.text: Cusco is a tourist mecca like Venice and its central streets are lined with trinket shops, restaurants and bars - - sidewalks are clogged with locals selling souvenirs, tours and massages. It can all be a bit overwhelming - or exhilarating, depending on your mood.
reviews.title: Small & Peaceful Hotel with Great Staff

reviews.text: Fortunately, the entire area around Casa Cartagena is quiet and free of the hustle and bustle. Inside, the hotel compound is even more pleasant due to a smart re-design of the colonial structure that includes sitting areas, a bar, a garden and plenty of space for resting. Rooms are large and comfortable (exception: bathrooms are a little over-designed, with not-great lighting and showers that look good but splash the floor) and the common areas are inviting.
reviews.title: A Must Stay

reviews.text: The hotel itself is very good, but the BEST part is its wonderful staff. From the minute we arrived to the multiple times they helped with reservations, directions, room service, dinner and breakfast in the hotel restaurant - and a very early departure, everything was handled cheerfully, efficiently and quickly. It was, without a doubt, some of the best service I have ever had at a hotel. A+
reviews.title: A real looker, just overlook the front desk

reviews.text: From the moment we arrived we were greeted with exceptional service. The hotel offers the feeling of a home away from home. It's stylish, personal and staff cater to your every need and more. Congratulations on achieving that special ambience that makes you not want to leave and leaves you wanting to come back for more.
reviews.title: Amazing boutique Hotel in Cusco!!!!!!

reviews.text: From the moment we arrived until the moment we left, the experience was outstanding. We were greeted with some cocoa tea, chocolates, and a tour of the property. The hotel is amazing. It looks recently renovated, but with a lot of the original character of the original building. Our room was large and had a nice balcony overlooking the courtyard. The best part was the staff. From the front desk to the restaurant staff to the management, everything we needed was taken care of.
reviews.title: Amazing property, outstanding service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During my trip to Machu Picchu, my passport was stolen. When I returned to the hotel, they immediately began to help me with the process. They made phone calls on my behalf and were sincerely concerned. I have to recognize Arturo the bellman for saving the day/ He personally took me to the police station to fill out a report. The hotel sent him to help with translating as I speak very little Spanish. This was above and beyond. The process took a couple of hours, but Arturo was with me the entire time, not just translating but also trying to make me feel better about the situation and keeping me calm. You can't put a price on that kind of service. I owe my sanity and positive outcome to the situation to Arturo and the staff. I can't thank them enough.

reviews.title: Peruvian Paradise

description: Casa Cartagena CuscoHigh in the Peruvian Andes lies the historic city of Cuzco, famous for its unique blend of Spanish and Incan cultures. Located just off a tranquil square behind the main plaza of Cuzco, Casa Cartagena Boutique Hotel & Spa Cusco emerges after years of restoration, which respected the original design of the historic house, to become one of the most exclusive boutique hotels in the city. Its walls of carved stone, which combines warmth, elegance and perfection, invite you to experience the fascinating magic and traditional mysticism that will transport you through time in this historic Spanish house declared a cultural heritage site of Peru.Its lovely atmosphere was built on an ancient Incan site, occupied by the ruling nobility of that time and from which it takes its name: Casa Cartagena, former property of the local Spanish ruler of Cuzco, Don Fernando Cartagena and Santa Cruz.This luxury hotel in Cuzco is an intimate refuge that has only sixteen spacious and comfortable suites, which perfectly blend the modern with the ancestral and luxury with the historical. The rooms are distributed symmetrically along a spacious patio of your dreams where time is suspended. It is located in the historic center of Cuzco, which was declared by UNESCO as a world heritage site.Recovery from an exhausting trip to Machu Picchu or the Sacred Valley of the Incas with our Qoya Spa will be something truly unequalled. It can be perfectly complemented with a delicious dinner in our restaurant which offers the best of local cuisine, "La bodega de la Chola", where poet Pablo Neruda was inspired and Che Guevara shared bohemian nights; it is considered one of the best restaurants in Cuzco.All of these unique features of Casa Cartagena and our warm and personalized service will make your stay in Cuzco an experience you will never forget.
